step.title: Thermal management for automotive, bus and truck

paragraph.htmltext:
Follow the battery manufacturerâ€™s recommendations on proper retention, positioning, and application through the control strategies.

Some of the key areas for the vehicle manufacturer are:

  • Avoidance of condensation within the battery pack.
  • Avoidance of leaks in liquid systems.
  • Containments that would cause the loss of electrical isolation.
  • Operating temperature range of the battery modules.

Methods for cooling and heating the battery modules should be agreed to by the battery and the vehicle manufacturer. For heating the following concerns needs to be taken into account.

  • Attachment of heater devices
  • Reliability of connections
  • Breach of high-voltage system
  • Rate of heat transfer to not deform the battery case material or adversely affect electrochemical functioning or shorten life
  • Insulation surrounding the battery

For cooling the following apply

  • Attachment of cooling devices
  • Reliability of connections
  • Breach of high-voltage system
  • Rate of heat transfer to not deform the battery case material or adversely affect electrochemical functioning or shorten life
  • Insulation surrounding the battery
